name: Unified Font Repository
tagline: Repository architecture example for a typeface design project
body:
## What is that?

Unified Font Repository is a proposal for the standardization of typeface design in an open source context. It also aims for the promotion of open source typography by introducing a transversal and flexible classification. Technically, UFR is a folder architecture to organize font sources, inspirations and references. It is also a YAML file with useful meta informations about the typeface and its repository.

METADATA.yml contains the data useful to build a large independant database of typefaces. With this kind of identity informations, it can be easy to search and browse fonts by license, similar fonts, authors, keywordsâ€¦ METADATA.yml also reflects the folder structure and can link to the font files, github repository etc.

## Specification

### METADATA.yml

#### Tags

As a font designer you are free to chose the tags you find relevant for your font but we encourage the use of the following tags, in order of importance:

- Type: serif, sans-serif, cursive, fantasy, monospace, handwriting
- Feelings: contrasted, smooth, light, weird
- Time and location: 80s, China, Africa
